{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3242889,"name":"Floyd Moore","username":"feverittm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/feverittm/{size}/4928_2.png","created_at":"2023-10-19T17:05:25.090Z","cooked":"

We are looking to configure our swerve drive using the YAGSL library. Reading the documentation we should be able to use our SparkMax connected CTRE Encoders (connected to the sensor connector on the DutyCycle input) as the absolute reference. Correct?

Besides the absolute encoder, our configuration is fairly simple: SDS 4i, Neo’s, NavX. So as far as I can read in the examples/docs this should work easily. I just wanted to validate the configuration for the absolute encoder.

We have been able to read all the encoders and move the motors while tracking changes on the SmartDashboard to verify basic configuration. So we know the hardware and basic code working. We have also been able to extract the offset and inversion parameters for each module as well.

Thank You.

CTRE MagEncoder should be supported, if you connect it to the spark max be sure to use the encoder type of attached and check it in the hardware client

Thank you for the response. We will give that a shot next week when we meet again. I am going to try and spend some of the weekend pulling together a configuration and trying to run it in simulation.

Enjoy!

For wiring these encoders, you might want to check out this thread: Using the VEX SRX Mag Encoders with Spark Max.

If you look down that post: Using the VEX SRX Mag Encoders with Spark Max - #36 by andej
you will see a post from andej who was on our team. He created a small daughtercard that went on the SparkMax and connected to the Gadgeteer cable to the encoder. There were a couple of small issues with revision 1.0, but the later rev 1.1 works fine.
We can easily access the absolute position from the CTRE encoder from the SparkMax api.

Thanks.
